data.title: T.L. Ford II - Football
data.meta_description: T.L. Ford II (5) Wide Receiver  - At Charlotte: 87 yards shy of becoming program’s third career 1000-yard receiver ... Two-year starter who has played in all 35
data.text:
At Charlotte: 87 yards shy of becoming program’s third career 1000-yard receiver ... Two-year starter who has played in all 35 games over the last three years ... third in 49ers history with 77 career receptions and 913 receiving yards ... a member of the 49ers third recruiting class, signed in February, 2014. 2016: Started all 12 games in 2016 ... second on team in receptions (36), yards (430) and receiving TDs (4) ... averaged 11.9 yards per catch; 35.8 yards per game ... 49ers went 3-1 in games in which he caught a TD, including at Florida Atlantic in 49ers first-ever C-USA win and at Southern Miss ... 37-yard TD catch at FAU from Hasaan Klugh is his longest career TD reception ... high of six catches vs. Elon for 64 yards, including a 12-yd TD ... high of 92 rec. yards at Temple on five catches ... over 50 yards receiving in each of the 49ers first four games ... added a 28-yard TD vs. Eastern Michigan and an 18-yard TD at Southern Miss. ... longest catch of the season was a 39-yard reception in season-opener at #19 Louisville (2 rec.; 53 yds) ... had 12 catches of 15+ yards ... caught at least one pass in all 12 games. 2015: Played in all 12 games with 11 starts in the 49ers first season at the FBS level as a member of C-USA ... third on the team with 27 catches and 262 yards ... averaged 9.7 yards per catch and 21.8 yards per game ... had seven catches for 15 or more yards ... longest catch was a 25-yd pass from Lee McNeill at Old Dominion ... had high of six catches in season-finale at Rice for 54 yards ... had five catches (all for first downs) in inaugural FBS game at Georgia State for a season-high 63 yards ... caught at least one pass in all but one game, including last nine ... had four games with at least 3 catches ... 17 of his 27 catches were for first downs. 2014: Played in all 11 games as a true freshman … second on the team with four receiving touchdowns … tied for third on team with four TDs … had three TD catches in the last three games (5 yd vs. #2/#3 Coastal Carolina; 12 yard vs. Wesley; 21 vs. Morehead State) … first collegiate TD came on his first collegiate catch: a 24-yard catch in home opener vs. Johnson C. Smith (2 rec.; season-high 51 yds) … two catches of 20+ yards vs. JC Smith (24, 27) … had 14 catches (T4th) for 221 yards (5th) … averaged 20.1 yards per game and 15.8 yards per catch … longest catch was a 35-yard catch vs. #2/#3 Coastal Carolina … had eight catches of 15 or more yards; seven of 20 or more … high of three catches (43 yds) vs. Charleston Southern … 12 of 14 catches; 210 of 221 yards and all four TDs came at home.

At Cartersville: An AP honorable mention all-state AAA choice and a first team all-Region 5AAA selection ... a three-star recruit by ESPN.com ... had 12 Division I offers ... had 589 yards receiving as a senior to help Purple Hurricanes to an 11-2 mark ... quarterback was Brooks Barden, who signed with the 49ers in December and joined the team in the spring 2014 semester ... teammate of fellow signee Mark Quattlebaum ...senior stats included 8 touchdowns and a 19.63 receiving average per catch ... had 560 yards receiving as a junior with 10 touchdowns ... named honorable mention all-state AAA by the Atlanta Journal Constitution ... led Hurricanes and head coach Frank Barden to a 13-1 mark and a Region V AAA championship ... advanced to the state semifinals ... played basketball and baseball in high school.

Personal: Born Feb. 21, 1996 ... Son of Cherrell Ray and Terry L. Ford .... siblings are Timothy Baker Jr., Cierra Ford, Tristan Ford and Tyler Ford ... Atlanta Falcons and Braves fan.

Year G-S Rcv Yds Avg TD* Avg/G

2014 11-0 14 221 15.8 4/4 20.1

2015 12-11 27 262 9.7 0/0 21.8

2016 12-12 36 430 11.9 4/4 35.8

Total 35-23 77 913 11.9 8/8 26.1

* Rec. TD/Overall TD
